title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 05 December 2013 - XWiki
content:

07:42 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
08:10 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:14 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:25 <vmassol> mflorea: good morning  
08:26 <mflorea> vmassol: good morning  
08:26 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
08:26 <vmassol> since today is BFD I think it's dangerous to commit on master. Do you think we could branch all repos for RC1 now?  
08:27 <vmassol> (I have some commits to do for the BFD day now but they're a bit too dangerous for 5.3RC1 or final)  
08:27 <mflorea> yes, I think that's a good idea  
08:28 <vmassol> ok great, are you doing it, do you need me to do it?  
08:31 <mflorea> I can do it in a few minutes, but I need to do a last commit first  
08:31 <vmassol> ok  
08:31 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping  
08:32 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Pong  
08:32 <vmassol> sdumitriu: if I commit a fix for XWIKI-9753 would you be able to verify it works on a snapshot?  
08:32 <sdumitriu> Yes  
08:32 <vmassol> ok good, I think I have something that works  
08:33 <vmassol> I'd like to commit it first on master (5.4M1) and then backport to 5.3 or even 5.2.2 if the full build passes  
08:33 <vmassol> it means upgrading HC to 2.7-SNAPSHOT (from 2.5  
08:33 <vmassol> )

09:17 <vmassol> (unless your commit is safe and should absolutely go in 5.3)  
09:17 <mflorea> yep, done with my commit, creating the branches now  
09:17 <vmassol> ok cool  
09:23 <cjd> has joined #xwiki

09:46 <mflorea> ;)  
10:44 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <DarkKnightCZ> what is the best way how to get documents, that were updated last month? (i guess hql query where doc.contendUpdateDate >= 1.month, but i have trouble getting date object representing first day of month), any ideas?  
10:57 <DarkKnightCZ> of course there is always possibility to do it outside sql  
10:58 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: good question  
10:58 <vmassol> I'd love to know the answer and document it on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Query+Module  
10:58 <vmassol> now I know the answer for HQL:  
10:58 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/velocityHqlExamples#HAdvancedQuery28date26time29  
10:59 <vmassol> this might give you some inspiration for XWQL  
10:59 <vmassol> maybe this might help too: http://www.objectdb.com/java/jpa/query/jpql/date  
10:59 <DarkKnightCZ> nice, thanks  
11:00 <vmassol> yep I see we support htem  
11:00 <vmassol>     current\_date = c u r r e n t '\_' d a t e;  
11:00 <vmassol>     current\_time = c u r r e n t '\_' t i m e;  
11:00 <vmassol>     current\_timestamp = c u r r e n t '\_' t i m e s t a m p;  
11:00 <vmassol> (in our jpql parser)  
11:01 <vmassol> you can also always use a parametrized query  
11:01 <vmassol> and then use $datetool to compute the date  
11:02 <vmassol> once you get it work, would be great if you could document it on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Query+Module ;)  
11:04 <DarkKnightCZ> yep :)  
11:16 <vmassol> sdumitriu: could you try with http://maven.xwiki.org/externals/net/sourceforge/htmlcleaner/htmlcleaner/2.7-20131205-xwiki/ ?  
11:17 <vmassol> note that the title issue is not fixed yet  
11:17 <vmassol> (I don't know if that's a blocker for you)  
11:17 <vmassol> Scott says he'll have a shot at it tonight  
11:23 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: should this go in RC1 or final?  
11:23 <vmassol> mflorea: when do you start the release?  
11:24 <mflorea> as soon as the CI calms down :)  
11:24 <vmassol> if I push GD's change it won't calm down  
11:24 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:24 <mflorea> I'll wait a bit more, if it's important  
11:25 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: let us know  
11:25 <mflorea> (I can find something else to do in the mean time :) )  
11:25 <vmassol> update translations?  
11:25 <vmassol> :)  
11:25 <mflorea> yep  
11:25 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: it's not a blocker  
11:25 <gdelhumeau> it could be in final  
11:25 <gdelhumeau> it's a BFD fix :)  
11:26 <mflorea> then let's leave it for final  
11:47 <vmassol> tmortagne/sburjan: there are 2 issues marked 5.2.2: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9770?filter=12503&jql=category%20in%20(%22Top%20Level%20Projects%22)%20AND%20fixVersion%20in%20(%225.2.2%22)%20AND%20resolution%20in%20(Unresolved)%20AND%20component%20not%20in%20(%22Development%20Issues%20only%22)  
11:47 <vmassol> they're both valid for 5.2.2?  
11:47 <vmassol> (ie we can't release 5.2.2 without them)  
11:48 <sburjan> vmassol: yes, they both affect 5.2.2  
11:48 <sburjan> but IMO XWIKI-9768 is not that serious  
11:49 <sburjan> and also hard to fix ATM  
11:52 <tmortagne> vmassol: depends how blocker it is that the user have to choose the new version when getting a conflict for that page  
11:53 <tmortagne> you get the result described by sburjan only if you click on continue without choosing anything  
11:53 <vmassol> ok, what about the other issue with the title?  
11:53 <vmassol> ah you mean the default is not the right one hmm  
11:53 <vmassol> so users will most often use the default  
11:54 <vmassol> it's only 4.1.4?  
11:54 <tmortagne> the default is a merge try which gives priority to current  
11:54 <tmortagne> and in this particular case we fully want the new version  
11:55 <tmortagne> no it's not not 4.1.4, it's any pre 5.2 AFAIK  
11:55 <tmortagne> s/not not/not only/  
11:55 <tmortagne> nice page name  
11:56 <vmassol> and hard to delete  
11:56 <tmortagne> can't reach the page, looks like we have a bug  
11:56 <tmortagne> (even from the document index)  
11:57 <vmassol> yep I've tried too  
12:03 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:46 <mflorea> has quit  
12:51 <jbernard\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:56 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
13:00 <Slashman> has quit  
13:10 <j-simard> has quit  
13:11 <vmassol> [Challenge of the day] deleting the page created by LinaIosifidou (see http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/AllDocs#|t=alldocs&p=1&l=15&s=doc.date&d=desc )  
13:12 <vmassol> ????????? ??????????? ?????????  
13:12 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
13:12 <sburjan> that's greek ?  
13:12 <vmassol> yes  
13:13 <vmassol> means "Advanced Information Systems"  
13:13 <vmassol> I think xwiki.org is still on ISOxxx and not UTF8  
13:16 <vmassol> hehe almost there  
13:16 <vmassol> :)  
13:17 <camil7> the Index URL-encoded the HTML-Encoded version  
13:19 <vmassol> for the record I just used the {{html}} macro to get the real name (the greek version above)  
13:19 <vmassol> and then used $xwiki.getDocument() to get the doc  
13:19 <vmassol> and then doc.delete()  
13:19 <vmassol> I couldn't the page to display with the view action though  
13:20 <vmassol> s/the page/get the page/  
13:21 <vmassol> argh  
13:21 <vmassol> build failure in commons  
13:21 <camil7> I testet locally by creating a page with that name, and everything works well as long as XWiki is all on UTF-8, so its not an XWiki bug at least ;)  
13:22 <vmassol> stupid bot!  
13:22 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-commons/1145/console  
13:23 <vmassol> I don't understand, normally the xwiki remote repo is defined in settings.xml on agents no?  
13:24 <vmassol> works locally  
13:26 <vmassol> guys, ok to remove the 4.5.x biulds on ci?  
13:27 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
13:43 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
14:24 <vmassol> be careful that will need to be merged to 5.3 after RC1 is released  
14:28 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:32 <tmortagne> should be merged before RC1 IMO  
14:33 <vmassol> mflorea is back  
14:33 <tmortagne> nice, pretty much everything is failing on jenkins...  
14:34 <mflorea> on master, not on 5.3  
14:34 <vmassol> mflorea: what's the status re the release?  
14:34 <mflorea> if you commit on 5.3 I'll have to wait a few more hours  
14:34 <mflorea> I haven't started, was waiting for the 5.3 builds to finish  
14:34 <vmassol> and we don't want that IMO  
14:35 <mflorea> yes, I prefer that we leave the commits on stable-5.3.x for after RC1  
14:35 <tmortagne> vmassol: did you deployed htmlcleaner 2.7-20131205-xwiki ?  
14:36 <vmassol> yes  
14:36 <vmassol> I don't know why it cannot find it, works locally  
14:36 <vmassol> can you try on your side?  
14:37 <vmassol> unless  
14:37 <tmortagne> you sure you deployed it before modifying commons ?  
14:37 <vmassol> unless I don't remember and I did some special setup to not using settings.xml for commons/rendering  
14:37 <vmassol> to ensure all deps are on central  
14:37 <tmortagne> yes you did  
14:37 <vmassol> hmm that woudln't work for snapsnots anyway  
14:37 <tmortagne> and we can't use something that does not come from central on commons  
14:37 <vmassol> where is it thomas?  
14:38 <tmortagne> no idea, you are the one who did it :)  
14:38 <tmortagne> I don't see why it would not work for snapshot  
14:38 <vmassol> ahah  
14:38 <vmassol> I see:  
14:38 <vmassol> -Dcommons.rendering.profile  
14:38 <vmassol> checking that  
14:39 <tmortagne> anyway commons cannot depend on something that it's not on master  
14:39 <vmassol> yes I know  
14:39 <vmassol> check my comits and the jira issue  
14:39 <tmortagne> s/it's/is/  
14:39 <vmassol> I explained it  
14:40 <vmassol> ok found it  
14:40 <vmassol> a profile defined in settings.xml on all agents  
14:40 <vmassol> had forgotten about this  
14:40 <vmassol> nice check ;)  
14:40 <vmassol> but a problem now  
14:41 <vmassol> I can remove it temporarily but would need to remember to put it back  
14:42 <vmassol> trigging build manually ATM, I'd like to see a full build to see if nothing breaks  
14:43 <vmassol> my bet is that Scott will release 2.7 before 5.4M1. Should be a safe bet since he's plannig to release real soon now and he knows our need  
14:43 <vmassol> (I'd say we'll get a release within 10 days)  
14:45 <vmassol> I've noted it down in my agenda to put back the profile in 1 week from new (for the next BFD)  
14:47 <vmassol> sburjan: I'd like to move the 2 issues for 5.2.3  
14:47 <vmassol> (I'm not even sure we'll need to release 5.2.3 but that's another matter)  
14:47 <sburjan> vmassol: okay  
14:47 <mflorea> sburjan: there are 3 issues opened for RC1, I'm going to move them to final  
14:48 <vmassol> I'm doing http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9768 mflorea  
14:48 <sburjan> vmassol: IMO we should at least mention the 2 issues in the RN, this should be OK  
14:48 <vmassol> sburjan: sure  
14:48 <sburjan> okay then, I'm ok with this  
14:48 <mflorea> vmassol: for 5.3 final right?  
14:48 <vmassol> doing http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9770 too  
14:48 <vmassol> no  
14:48 <mflorea> ?  
14:48 <vmassol> no time  
14:49 <mflorea> I don't understand, you want to fix them for RC1?  
14:49 <vmassol> no  
14:49 <vmassol> tmortagne says it's too complex  
14:49 <vmassol> for 5.3  
14:49 <mflorea> ok  
14:49 <mflorea> can you move the issues you plan to work on then?  
14:49 <mflorea> I'll move the rest to 5.4M1  
14:50 <mflorea> thanks  
14:51 <vmassol> ok  
14:51 <mflorea> I'll move XWIKI-9726 to 5.4M1  
14:52 <vmassol> mflorea: please leave http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-497 for 5.3 ATM  
14:52 <mflorea> ok  
14:53 <vmassol> ok I'm done on my side  
14:54 <UCC> has quit  
14:55 <sburjan> vmassol: when are you planning to release 5.2.2 ?  
14:55 <vmassol> sburjan: see mail  
15:06 <vmassol> cjd: I don't much about it but is it normal that it's under "Observable XWiki Events"?  
15:06 <vmassol> I think the idea is to list all our events  
15:06 <vmassol> which is different IMO  
15:07 <vmassol> I'd put jquery/requirejs at level 1  
15:07 <vmassol> yup  
15:07 <vmassol> :)  
15:07 <vmassol> thanks for documenting it!  
15:07 <cjd> yeah, I didn't realize the whole document was under observable events  
15:07 <cjd> thanks for reminding me  
15:08 <cjd> at first I wanted to keep it secret for a bit, then I did actually fgorget  
15:13 <vmassol> secret is never good  
15:13 <vmassol> it's better that's it not secret  
15:13 <vmassol> so that people can experiment  
15:13 <vmassol> you can mark it as experimental and subject to change in the documentation though ;)  
15:16 <sdumitriu> vmassol: re htmlcleaner-2.7-20131205-xwiki, what should I try? Is it used in the latest XWiki snapshot, or should I try it on top of XWiki 5.2?  
15:17 <vmassol> on top of 5.2  
15:17 <vmassol> by reaplcing your version of htmlcleaner  
15:17 <vmassol> or 5.3  
15:17 <vmassol> as you want  
15:18 <vmassol> it's a drop in replacement of HC with no other change in xwiki  
15:18 <vmassol> (sdumitriu)  
15:18 <sdumitriu> OK, testing  
15:18 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:23 <vmassol> ok same issue for rendering build, fixing  
15:33 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
15:34 <mflorea> tmortagne: l10n is broken, do you know if there were any recent code changes?  
15:34 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
15:35 <tmortagne> mflorea: fixing it  
15:35 <mflorea> "unable to resolve class JsonSlurper"  
15:35 <tmortagne> currently adding some stuff  
15:35 <mflorea> thanks  
15:36 <tmortagne> mflorea: should be ok now  
15:37 <mflorea> can I use it to update translations or do you need more time for your changes?  
15:37 <camil7> I would like to test the WikiStream UI ... it seems the "source" is a text field for now, and I need to change it to an upload field, e.g. to try some import from confluence ?  
15:38 <tmortagne> mflorea: you can use it, my change are about adding refactoring API to copy some translations between workspaces/wikimanager and new wiki module, they will go in 5.3  
15:38 <tmortagne> l10n is all yours  
15:38 <gdelhumeau> mea culpa  
15:39 <tmortagne> camil7: yes the Wikistream UI is a bit raw right now...  
15:39 <camil7> yes, ok, thought so, thanks :)  
15:39 <tmortagne> it does support getting upload data in input if you let the field empty but it lack some UI to help choosing a file or something  
15:41 <tmortagne> the source field take a URL by default right now so if your file is in the same server than XWiki you can put a file://path/to/my/file  
15:41 <mflorea> tmortagne: it still doesn't work. This URL for instance doesn't produce a valid zip file http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/L10NCode/GetTranslationFile?name=Platform.SandboxWebHome&app=Platform  
15:41 <mflorea> wait  
15:42 <tmortagne> camil7: actually you need to put url:file://path/to/my/file  
15:42 <camil7> ah, I have not tried that ... trying now  
15:42 <mflorea> no, it's fine  
15:42 <mflorea> nvm  
15:43 <tmortagne> camil7: now the simplest is maybe just for you to modify the page and put upload field if you know a bit of html ;)  
15:45 <tmortagne> camil7: what version are you testing by the way ?  
15:46 <camil7> only 5.3-m2 ... maybe I should rebuild from source, or wait for RC1  
16:00 <jbernard\_> has quit  
16:01 <jbernard\_> has joined #xwiki  
16:02 <tmortagne> hmm it was still working well enough in M2 to test confluence import  
16:02 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
16:04 <tmortagne> camil7: the best to test a parser IMO is to use the unit test framework I wrote  
16:04 <tmortagne> inspired from rendering test framework  
16:04 <vmassol> ah the greek guy found playground in the end: http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome  
16:04 <vmassol> however it's bad advertising for us that playground is also not in UTF8  
16:04 <tmortagne> yep  
16:05 <tmortagne> we really need to convert xwiki.org to utf8  
16:05 <vmassol> yes  
16:07 <camil7> tmortagne: ok, thanks. I had a short look at the framework, but used the UI to give it a quick shot. will now load the the stuff into my IDE ...  
16:08 <camil7> not sure about the backend part (e.g. DB), but converting the fronted to utf-8 should be not very difficult, if I remember correctly the last time I did something like  
16:09 <vmassol> I'll ping the infra guys  
16:09 <vmassol> but they're quite busy now  
16:09 <vmassol> so not the right time ;)  
16:09 <vmassol> let's remember to ping them tomorrow  
16:15 <camil7> btw, its not  really for the BFD, but I have a pull request for German translations for the Bulletin Board extension, in case there is interest: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-bulletinboard/pull/6  
16:16 <vmassol> camil7: applied, might have warranted some jira (for next time)  
16:17 <vmassol> thanks!  
16:17 <camil7> ah ok, I always forget about jira :) thanks, too!  
16:19 <evalica> has quit  
16:20 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
16:20 <evalica1> is now known as <evalica>  
16:22 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Did anyone try building with Maven 3.1?  
16:22 <vmassol> I did  
16:22 <sdumitriu> I get  Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.sonatype.aether.RepositorySystemSession  
16:23 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9760  
16:23 <sdumitriu> Exactly  
16:23 <vmassol> see also http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building  
16:23 <vmassol> now I need to find the time to fix it …. (or someone else)  
16:26 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:27 <vmassol> checking http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-rendering/org.xwiki.rendering$xwiki-rendering-macro-html/1550/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.rendering.test.integration/RenderingTest/macrohtml9\_test\_\_xwiki\_2\_0\_\_xhtml\_1\_0\_/  
16:27 <vmassol> caused by my update of htmlcleaner I'm sure  
16:29 <OSIMasson> has left #xwiki  
16:30 <vmassol> hey cool actually  
16:30 <vmassol> this fixed a bug :)  
16:31 <vmassol> (ah it's the bug I knew about, not a new one, fixing test)
